p: INF A/H1N1 was identified in 19% (41/211) of the patients hospitalized due to SARI ( Fig. 4 ); RSV in 8.5% (18/211) (figure). Of 292 children with ARI, 34% (100/292) required hospitalization; 6% (17/292) were hospitalized due to RSV infection which presented as single infection or co-infection. In adults, 31% (111/356) required hospitalization and 9.5% (34/356) were admitted due to single or mixed INF A/H1N1 infection. In this study, total of 12 pregnant females with ARI (11-2012, 1-2015) were tested and 3 were positive for INF A/H1N1 and all 3 were from Karaikal.
